title: Gentle Cleansing: Traditional Face Packs Reimagined
author: Harish
excerpt: Powdered traditional cleansers like besan and sandalwood are gentle, effective, and ideal for routine Ayurvedic skincare—learn how and when to use them.
content:
Why Powders Make Sense for Skin

Powder cleansers are concentrated, shelf-stable, and avoid many synthetic surfactants. When mixed fresh with rose water or hydrosols, they cleanse gently while delivering botanical benefits.

How to Use a Besan & Sandal Cleanser

  1. Mix 1–2 tsp powder with rose water to a smooth paste.
  2. Apply to damp skin and massage gently for under a minute.
  3. Rinse with cool water and pat dry; follow with a light toner and moisturizer.

Frequency & Dosha Notes

  • Pitta: Ideal—sandalwood and rose water cool and soothe.
  • Vata: Use with a touch of milk or yogurt to prevent dryness.
  • Kapha: Use sparingly and avoid heavy application on oily days.

Precautions

A small amount of turmeric can stain; use sparingly and avoid sensitive under-eye areas. If you have eczema or very reactive skin, consult a dermatologist before routine use.
